reportng¶

reportng is a python module to build on the fly reports. It leverages Bootstrap 4 to automatically create using user defined bootswatch themes. reportng is capable of handling any python out including but not limited to api output, stdio output, sql queries etc.

Some example use cases of reportng are

  • Create a report for a tool
  • Create a report of a test
  • Create a report of debugging
  • etc…

Installation¶

pip install reportng

Documentation¶

Python report generator that wraps around bootstrap 4 using dominate. Usage is simple. Follows header, body…, footer structure

class reportng.ReportWriter(report_name, brand, asciinema=False, code_highlight=False)¶

The main class that is used. Modifiable parameters are report_name, theme, brand and highlight_color

report_add_image_carousel(*args)¶
Parameters: args (list) – A list of image paths
Returns: image jumbotron carousel container
report_asciinema(asciinema_link, title='')¶

Section creates a jumbotron to house an asciinema

Parameters:
  • asciinema_link (str) – Link to asciinema. Could be http/s or local files
  • title (str) – Set the title of the asciinema. If set, it will create its own section.
report_code_section(title, code)¶

This section can use used to add code containers that will be lexed and highlighted using highlight.js

Parameters:
  • title (str) – Title of the code section.
  • code (str) – Code. Use pre and code tags so multiline code is fine
Returns:

a string code section
report_footer(message='', **kwargs)¶

Returns the footer object. Supports social media

Parameters:
  • message (str) – A message in the footer
  • kwargs (dict) – Supported paramters are email, linkedin, github and twitter
report_header(theme='lux', highlight_color='#f1c40f')¶

Controls the link and script tags in the head. This method should always be called at the top

Parameters:
  • theme (str) – Name of any bootswatch theme. Default is lux
  • highlight_color (str) – any rgb color. default is #f1c40f
Returns:

The head tag for the report.
report_notes(content)¶

Simple method to added some center aligned text.

Parameters: content (str) – content to add
report_section(title, content, pre_tag=True, tag_color='default', title_bg=True)¶

This form the main body of the report

Parameters:
  • title (str) – The h1/header title of the section
  • pre_tag (bool) – Default is True and treats content as monospaced. Set to False to use p tag
  • content (str) – The content for this section
  • tag_color (str) – The severity color of the section.
  • title_bg (bool) – Controls if the header background or text is colored. Default is True and lets background color.
Returns:

a jumbotron object
save_report(all_objects, path)¶

Saves the html file to disk

Parameters:
  • all_objects (str) – The tally of all the objects
  • path (str) – path to save the file
class reportng.ReportWriter(report_name, brand, asciinema=False, code_highlight=False)

The main class that is used. Modifiable parameters are report_name, theme, brand and highlight_color

__init__(report_name, brand, asciinema=False, code_highlight=False)¶

Assign theme and report name

Parameters:
  • brand (str) – Name of the company/tester
  • report_name (str) – Name of report. Default is Sample report
  • asciinema (bool) – Set to true to use asciinema’s in report. Default is False
  • code_highlight (bool) – Set to True in order to use code highlighting
